Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired reddish); two added white bands; exterior: part of a lotus flower with dilute outlines and added red centres; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Although Lemos does not discuss this sherd, it ought to belong to the group of vases with floral decoration in the Simple Animal Style. The lotus flower and lotus bud pattern found on these vessels appears on the exterior surface of the vases and in the later vases the pattern resembles that found on Fikellura vases.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1004) (phase 2)
